page.title: 18ATTITUDES 2
page.content: Miss Forbes is a person who has spent the whole of her life in Pitlochry and has of course seen many changes: not always for the better. Pitlochry has always been a tourist centre, but in Miss Forbes' youth there were few foreigners and most of the hotels had stables, as cars weren't much use on the poor, twisty roads. The town used to have a much more varied selection of shops, including three drapers, tailors, dressmakers, three butchers, three shoe shops etc. Farming was the area's life blood. In contrast, Miss Dyer, a school teacher from York, retired to Pitlochry, returning to the area of her childhood. Apart from the obvious scenic attractions, she appreciates the work of the local doctors and the presence of the Cottage Hospital.
